alice.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available.

private_information: Preference: minimize interruptions to my morning schedule when multiple slots are equally early
bob.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available.

carol.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participant availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that finds the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21, breaking ties by minimizing interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

public_information: Three colleagues must schedule a 30-minute meeting on Tuesday 2025-10-21.
Participants are Alice, Bob, and Carol.
The meeting should be scheduled at the earliest possible 30-minute slot when all three are available.
If multiple equally early slots exist, choose the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

availability.system_prompt: You are Alice providing your precise availability and any scheduling preferences. Output a machine-readable list of time intervals for the date in the environment without generating PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is alice. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->alice->private_information}. Provide a concise machine-readable availability statement for 2025-10-21 and include any local preferences relevant to scheduling.

availability.system_prompt: You are Bob providing your precise availability and any scheduling preferences. Output a machine-readable list of time intervals for the date in the environment without generating PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is bob. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->bob->private_information}. Provide a concise machine-readable availability statement for 2025-10-21 and include any local preferences relevant to scheduling.

availability.system_prompt: You are Carol providing your precise availability and any scheduling preferences. Output a machine-readable list of time intervals for the date in the environment without generating PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is carol. Use the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->carol->private_information}. Provide a concise machine-readable availability statement for 2025-10-21 and include any local preferences relevant to scheduling.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that can be solved with the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions and origins distinct when modeling multiple agents and include time discretized according to environment init.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the public information {environment->public_information} and the following availability reports: {alice_availability}, {bob_availability}, {carol_availability}. Build a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the scheduling task for 2025-10-21 with 30-minute slots and time granularity 30 minutes. The domain must allow finding the earliest 30-minute slot when all three are available. If multiple earliest slots are possible, the plan should prefer slots that minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule as stated in the public information. Keep agent actions distinct and produce a domain and problem compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
